sections.title: Skin boosters for hydration and elasticity
sections.body: Skin boosters aim to support hydration and texture for suitable patients. We’ll explain what they can and can’t do, and expected maintenance.
bullets: Consultation-led selection of product and treatment sites
Course planning (often 2–3 sessions) with clear intervals
Aftercare that protects skin barrier while you heal

sections.title: Gentle protocols with medical products
items: CE-marked booster products stored and prepared under controlled conditions
Aseptic microinjection technique with single-use needles
Course-based dosing to avoid overload and monitor response
Clear escalation routes if you experience unexpected swelling or irritation

sections.title: Skin-first assessment before treatment
sections.body: We review skin health, hydration, and lifestyle factors to decide whether boosters are suitable. Where appropriate, we plan microinjections across cheeks, peri-oral areas, neck, or hands, and discuss how boosters differ from fillers (/treatments/dermal-fillers) or polynucleotides (/treatments/polynucleotides).
bullets: Medical history and skin examination to confirm suitability
Course design (typically two initial sessions 3–4 weeks apart)
Advice on pausing active skincare and planning around events
Written consent and aftercare before treatment begins

sections.title: For skin needing hydration and fine-texture support
items: Patients with dryness or fine crepiness seeking improved glow without volume
Those wanting a medical alternative to topical-only hydration
Suitable for many skin types when no active infection or contraindication is present
Patients ready to follow a course schedule and maintenance as advised

sections.title: Plan, treat, review
items: Consultation: suitability check, photography, and course planning
Treatment sessions: microdroplet injections with numbing support if needed
Review: follow-up after the initial sessions to assess hydration and skin feel
Maintenance: booster top-ups scheduled based on response and seasonality
sections.strapline: Skin boosters build gradually. We do not rush sessions or stack products when the skin needs time to respond.

sections.title: Microinjection patterns for even spread
sections.body: We use fine needles and controlled depth to place microdroplets evenly, focusing on superficial planes to improve hydration without altering facial structure.
sections.mediaHint: Microdroplet skin booster technique across cheek and lower face

sections.title: Protect skin barrier while it settles
items: Expect pinpoint marks or light swelling for 24–72 hours; bruising is possible
Avoid makeup, hot environments, and active skincare until advised
Contact us if you notice increasing pain, unusual warmth, or colour changes
We plan maintenance only once skin has settled and you’re comfortable

faqs.question: How are boosters different from fillers?
faqs.answer: Boosters are runnier, hydrating injectables that improve skin texture rather than adding volume. We avoid mixing them with volume-driven fillers in the same plane.

faqs.question: When will I see changes?
faqs.answer: Most patients notice improved hydration and suppleness after the first sessions, with further gains after the second or third treatment.

faqs.question: Can they be combined with anti-wrinkle care?
faqs.answer: Often yes, when staged safely. We sequence treatments so skin can settle and prescription medicines remain effective.

faqs.question: What if I have sensitive skin?
faqs.answer: We assess barrier health first. If skin is inflamed or compromised, we may delay boosters and focus on repair before proceeding.

faqs.question: How long do results last?
faqs.answer: Maintenance varies but top-ups are often recommended every few months once the initial course is complete.
